p: The antimicrobial activity of extracts and essential oils of fruits and leaves of P. dioica has been demonstrated. P. dioica leaf extracts showed significant antimicrobial properties against Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus mutans, Escherichia coli, Bacillus cereus, Salmonella typhimurium, Candida albicans, Pseudomonas fluorescens, Bacillus megaterium, Aspergillus niger, and Penicillium sp. [ 17, 18, 19, 20]. In another study the essential oil of P. dioica leaves showed growth inhibition of Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Salmonella typhi, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Bacillus cereus [ 21]. The essential oil of P. dioica fruits showed significant antimicrobial properties against Acinetobacter baumannii, Staphylococcus aureus, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Candida albicans, and other yeasts of the Candida genus [ 8, 22].
